Posts.Content: May 19, 2009 12:21PM lynninpa wrote: FYI - there is a really great oncotype dx thread on the chemotherapy board, listing people's oncotype scores and their treatment regimens.  Extremely helpful.
Posts.Title: oncotype DX test MED lynninpa

Posts.Content: May 29, 2009 02:00PM lynninpa wrote: I looked up the French study that found that calendula was better than trolamine (Biafine cream).  The exact formulation tested was "Pommade au Calendula par Digestion" made by Boiron Ltd. which is an ointment.  (here is the actual study:  http://jco.ascopubs.org/cgi/content/abstract/22/8/1447 )  Are you using the calendula ointment made by Boiron?  Right now I am using Biafine but am thinking of switching to Boiron calendula ointment because of this study and because other women on this board have had such good results.  I am going to ask my rad oncologist next week.  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Calendula ointment Linda37 twirlgirl
